contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Settlement |name = Polkowice County |native_name=Powiat polkowicki |settlement_type=[[Powiat|County]] |image_flag = POL powiat polkowicki flag.svg |image_shield = POL powiat polkowicki COA.svg |image_map = POL powiat polkowicki map.svg|map_caption=Location within the voivodeship |image_map1=powiat polkowicki.jpg|map_caption1=Map of the county |subdivision_type=Country |subdivision_name={{POL}} |subdivision_type1=[[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] |subdivision_name1=[[Lower Silesian Voivodeship|Lower Silesian]] |seat = [[Polkowice]] |parts_type = [[Gmina]]s |parts = Total 6|p1=[[Gmina Chocianów]]|p2=[[Gmina Gaworzyce]]|p3=[[Gmina Grębocice]]|p4=[[Gmina Polkowice]]|p5=[[Gmina Przemków]]|p6=[[Gmina Radwanice]] |area_total_km2 = 779.93 |total_type=Total |population_total = 61138 |population_as_of = 2006 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_urban=37045 |population_blank1_title=Rural |population_blank1=24093 |blank_name=[[Polish car number plates|Car plates]] |blank_info=DPL |website=http://www.powiatpolkowicki.pl }} __NOTOC__ '''Polkowice County''' ({{lang-pl|powiat polkowicki}}) is a unit of territorial administration and local government ([[powiat]]) in [[Lower Silesian Voivodeship]], south-western [[Poland]]. It came into being on January 1, 1999, as a result of the [[Polish local government reforms]] passed in 1998. The county covers an area of {{convert|779.9|km2|sqmi|1}}. Its administrative seat is the town of [[Polkowice]], and it also contains the towns of [[Chocianów]] and [[Przemków]]. As at 2006 the total population of the county is 61,138, out of which the population of Polkowice is 22,279, that of Chocianów is 8,215, that of Przemków is 6,551, and the rural population is 24,093. == Neighbouring counties == Polkowice County is bordered by [[Głogów County]] to the north, [[Lubin County]] to the south-east, [[Legnica County]] to the south, [[Bolesławiec County]] to the south-west and [[Żagań County]] to the west. == Administrative division == The county is subdivided into six [[gmina]]s (three urban-rural and three rural). These are listed in the following table, in descending order of population. {| width="60%" border="2" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="font-size:90%;line-height:120%;" |-bgcolor="F0F8FF" | style="text-align:center;"|'''Gmina''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Type''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Area<br><small>(km²)</small>''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Population<br><small>(2006)</small>''' | style="text-align:center;"|'''Seat''' |- |[[Gmina Polkowice]] |urban-rural | style="text-align:right;"|158.8 | style="text-align:right;"|26,034 |[[Polkowice]] |- |[[Gmina Chocianów]] |urban-rural | style="text-align:right;"|230.3 | style="text-align:right;"|12,765 |[[Chocianów]] |- |[[Gmina Przemków]] |urban-rural | style="text-align:right;"|108.0 | style="text-align:right;"|8,826 |[[Przemków]] |- |[[Gmina Grębocice]] |rural | style="text-align:right;"|121.9 | style="text-align:right;"|5,290 |[[Grębocice]] |- |[[Gmina Radwanice]] |rural | style="text-align:right;"|84.0 | style="text-align:right;"|4,374 |[[Radwanice, Polkowice County|Radwanice]] |- |[[Gmina Gaworzyce]] |rural | style="text-align:right;"|77.0 | style="text-align:right;"|3,849 |[[Gaworzyce]] |- |} ==References== *[http://www.stat.gov.pl/gus/45_655_PLK_HTML.htm Polish official population figures 2006] <br> {{Polkowice County}} {{Lower Silesian Voivodeship}} {{coord|51|50|N|16|05|E|source:itwiki_type:adm2nd|display=title}} [[Category:Polkowice County| ]] [[Category:Land counties of Lower Silesian Voivodeship]]
